decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed single storey rear extension, and pergola, by reason of its excessive depth, height, scale, and bulk is considered to result in an unreasonable degree of impacts in terms of visual impact, overshadowing, daylight on the amenities of adjoining neighbouring properties in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM 1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposed balcony to the rear at first floor level is not a characteristic within this locality, and by reason of its siting, it would create an unacceptable level of actual and perceived overlooking and a loss of privacy to the detriment of the residential amenities of the neighbouring occupiers at No.31 and No.35 Drummond Drive, contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Core Strategy Policy CS1.B (2012), policies DM1 and DM26 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Single storey side to rear extension; roof terrace with glass balustrade to rear at first floor level; alterations and extension to raise garage roof height; installation of garage doors to front; raised decking and pergola at rear; external alterations (part demolition of attached garage)
